org.osmdroid.bonuspack.overlays
Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Overlay
      org.osmdroid.bonuspack.overlays.Polygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.osmdroid.views.util.constants.OverlayConstants
public class Polygon
extends org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Overlay

A polygon on the earth's surface. Mimics the Polygon class from Google Maps Android API v2 as much as possible. Main differences:
- Doesn't support: Z-Index, Geodesic mode
- Supports InfoWindow.

Author:
Viesturs Zarins, Martin Pearman for efficient PathOverlay.draw method, M.Kergall: transformation from PathOverlay to Polygon
See Also:
Google Maps Polygon

setInfoWindow

public void setInfoWindow(InfoWindow infoWindow)
By default, Polygon has no InfoWindow and do not react to a tap.

Parameters:
infoWindow - the InfoWindow to be opened when tapping the Polygon. Note that this InfoWindow will receive an ExtendedOverlayItem (not a Polygon) as an input, so it MUST be able to handle ExtendedOverlayItem attributes. It will be typically a DefaultInfoWindow. Set it to null to remove an existing InfoWindow.

contains

public boolean contains(MotionEvent event,
                        org.osmdroid.views.MapView mapView)
Important note: this function returns correct results only if the Polygon has been drawn before, and if the MapView positioning has not changed.

Parameters:
event -
mapView -
Returns:
true if the Polygon contains the event position.
